main event: On October 13, 1957, at 1400 EDT in Indian Trails, Michigan, a ball-shaped object with a nearly circular shape was sighted, possibly resembling a balloon, with a high pitched humming sound, oscillating up and down.
interesting points: The object was described as possibly balloon, aircraft, or astronomical, and there was insufficient data for evaluation.
The sighting lasted for 5-10 seconds, with the object appearing to oscillate up and down on a line dividing the top and bottom.
At 22:35 hrs on October 11, 1957, three objects similar to meteors were observed at Indian Trails on Lake Erie in Monroe County, Michigan.
The objects were described as having a rail shape, parachute, silvery grey color, and possibly port holes, with peculiar characteristics that could not be identified.
The observation involved 15-20 students from Alma College in Michigan, and the weather was reported as clear and cool.
result: Possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon, with insufficient data for a conclusive evaluation.
sighted object: Ball-shaped object resembling a balloon with oscillating motion
photographs: No photographs present in the report
